(see answer) Asked on: K36612 - Primula Fruit Infusion Glass Beverage Dispenserwith Stand See all QVC Questions and Answers > Cooking&Dining Q&A > Tabletop Q&A > Serving Pieces Q&A Customer Questions&Answers for N/A K29048 - 6-piece Personal Size Chip&Dip Tray Set There's no need to worry about double dipping when you serve these trays alongside your chips and dip. Each oval-shaped, personal-sized tray has an area for chips and a round well to hold dip. And, because each one is a different color, guests can keep track of their tray with ease. Customer Questions&Answers: 2 Questions | 10 Answers Ask a New Question Overall Rating: 4.3 out of 5 Read All 11 Reviews 11 Choose a sort order Questions With the Most Helpful Answers Most Recent Questions Oldest Questions Questions With Most Recent Answers Questions With Oldest Answers Questions With Most Answers Can You Answer These Questions? Questions&Answers for N/A K29048 - 6-piece Personal Size Chip&Dip Tray Set Question Do these trays stack for storage? asked 2 years, 2 months ago By: Momofmany on K29048 - 6-piece Personal Size Chip&Dip Tray Set 6 answers Answers answer 1 yes they stack great answered 1 year, 10 months ago By: Aly-Rhodo answer 2 YES, they DO stack easily for storage. :) answered 2 years ago By: Beachdaze44 answer 3 Yes, mine arrived perfectly stacked. answered 2 years, 1 month ago By: NCC answer 4 Yes, they stack very neatly together. answered 2 years, 1 month ago By: neenacp answer 5 Yes, they stack beautifully and do not take up space when storing. answered 2 years, 2 months ago By: Anonymous answer 6 Yes, and in a very small space! answered 2 years, 2 months ago By: jbgordfan Question How much dip does it hold? How much does it hold? It looks tiny, will you be able to get a regular potato chip or tortilla chip down in it or is it too small/narrow? asked 2 years, 1 month ago By: humming on K29048 - 6-piece Personal Size Chip&Dip Tray Set 4 answers Answers answer 1 the dip slot is a little narrow - a bit larger than the paper ketchup cups you get at burger king. These plates are kid size, to small for an adult answered 1 year, 10 months ago By: Aly-Rhodo answer 2 The dip area is a bit small but it you fill it high you can manage to get dip onto the chip ... certainly not as easy as a large chip and dip platter (BUT then again there is always the person who double dips into those and then I am done) for personal size it works ok answered 2 years ago By: Beachdaze44 answer 3 Yes, they are tiny, however they held two (2) Soup spoonfuls of dip and caramel. There was adequate room for dipping and we were pleased with these. I just tried a potato chip in the dip cup and it worked fine. Didn't break the chip to fit, so hope this helps, I think you would find that these even though they are small holds a great deal. answered 2 years, 1 month ago By: apoplectic answer 4 The dip cup is about the size of a dipping sauce from a fast food restaurant. You could not realistically put a chip in there. Baby carrots would be about the only thing that would fit. answered 2 years, 1 month ago By: neenacp 1 of 1
